alert.note: Alert for Pembina (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 28 at 7:46AM CDT until May 06 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Grand Forks ND has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in North Dakota... Pembina River at Neche affecting Pembina County. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO SATURDAY, MAY 06... * WHAT...Major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Pembina River at Neche. * WHEN...From this afternoon to Saturday, May 06. * IMPACTS...At 20.5 feet, MAJOR FLOOD. Railroad upstream of gage is overtopped. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:45 AM CDT Friday the stage was 15.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon to a crest of 21.0 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Friday morning. Snowmelt and rain in southern Manitoba Canada has led to a new flood wave that is moving down the Pembina River which is expected to cause the river to rise at Neche into Major flood stage. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
